oka.gloss: South American wood sorrel cultivated for its edible tubers

okapi.gloss: similar to the giraffe but smaller with much shorter neck and stripe on the legs

okapia johnstoni.gloss: similar to the giraffe but smaller with much shorter neck and stripe on the legs

okay.gloss: being satisfactory or in satisfactory condition
in a satisfactory or adequate manner

okeechobee.gloss: a lake in southeast Florida to the north of the Everglades

okeechobee waterway.gloss: a waterway used by small boats to travel between the Atlantic Ocean and the Gulf of Mexico through Lake Okeechobee and the Caloosahatchee Canal and the Caloosahatchee River

oken.gloss: German naturalist whose speculations that plants and animals are made up of tiny living `infusoria' led to the cell theory (1779-1851)

okenfuss.gloss: German naturalist whose speculations that plants and animals are made up of tiny living `infusoria' led to the cell theory (1779-1851)

okinawa.gloss: a campaign in the closing days of World War II in the Pacific (April to June 1945)

okinawa campaign.gloss: a campaign in the closing days of World War II in the Pacific (April to June 1945)

okla..gloss: a state in south central United States

oklahoma.gloss: a state in south central United States

oklahoma city.gloss: capital and largest city of Oklahoma

oklahoman.gloss: a native or resident of Oklahoma

okra.gloss: tall coarse annual of Old World tropics widely cultivated in southern United States and West Indies for its long mucilaginous green pods used as basis for soups and stews

okra plant.gloss: tall coarse annual of Old World tropics widely cultivated in southern United States and West Indies for its long mucilaginous green pods used as basis for soups and stews

oktoberfest.gloss: a strong lager made originally in Germany for the Oktoberfest celebration
